tit.cmt: Princess と大文字にしました。

sen.j: 祐子内親王（ゆうし（すけこ）/さちこ ないしんのう）
sen.e: Imperial princess Yushi (Yushi (Sukeko)/Imperial princess Sachiko)
Imperial princess Yushi (Yushi (Sukeko)/Imperial princess Sachiko)
Imperial Princess Yushi (Imperial Princess Sukeko/Imperial Princess Sachiko)
sen.cmt: Princess と大文字にしました。

sen.e: She was a princess of the Emperor Gosuzaku.
She was the princess of Emperor Gosuzaku.
She was the princess of Emperor Gosuzaku.
She was a princess of the Emperor Showa.
She was the princess of Emperor Showa.
She was the princess of Emperor Showa.

tit.j: 祐子内親王 （後朱雀天皇皇女）
tit.e: Imperial princess Yushi (a princess of the Emperor Gosuzaku)
Imperial princess Yushi (princess of Emperor Gosuzaku)
Imperial Princess Yushi (princess of Emperor Gosuzaku)
tit.cmt: Princess と大文字にしました。

sen.j: 祐子内親王（ゆうし（すけこ）ないしんのう、長暦2年4月21日 (旧暦)（1038年5月27日 - 長治2年11月7日 (旧暦)（1105年12月15日））は後朱雀天皇第三皇女、母は中宮藤原げん子（敦康親王女で藤原頼通養女）。
sen.e: Imperial princess Yushi (May 27, 1038 - December 15, 1105) was the third princess of the Emperor Gosuzaku and her mother was Chugu (an empress consort) FUJIWARA no Genshi (a daughter of Imperial Prince Atsuyasu and an adopted daughter of FUJIWARA no Yorimichi).

Imperial princess Yushi (May 27, 1038 - December 15, 1105) was the third princess of the Emperor Gosuzaku and her mother was Chugu (an empress consort) FUJIWARA no Genshi (a daughter of Imperial Prince Atsuyasu and an adopted daughter of FUJIWARA no Yorimichi).

Imperial Princess Yushi (June 2, 1038 - December 22, 1105) was the third princess of the Emperor Gosuzaku and her mother was Chugu (the second consort of an emperor) FUJIWARA no Genshi (a daughter of Imperial Prince Atsuyasu and an adopted daughter of FUJIWARA no Yorimichi).
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。

sen.j: 別名高倉一宮あるいは高倉殿宮（高倉宮）。
sen.e: Her another name was Takakura no ichimiya or Takakuradono no miya (Takakura no miya).
Her other name was Takakura no ichimiya or Takakuradono no miya (Takakura no miya).
Her other name was Takakura no ichimiya or Takakuradono no miya (Takakura no miya).

sen.j: 同母妹にばい子内親王 (後朱雀天皇皇女)。
sen.e: Imperial princess Baishi (a princess of the Emperor Gosuzaku) was her half younger sister with the same mother.
Imperial princess Baishi (princess of Emperor Gosuzaku) was her half younger sister by the same mother.
Imperial Princess Baishi (princess of Emperor Gosuzaku) was her younger sister by the same mother.
sen.cmt: Princess と大文字にしました。同母妹→younger sister by the same mother としました。

sen.j: 藤原師通を養子とした。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Moromichi was her adopted son.
FUJIWARA no Moromichi was her adopted son.
FUJIWARA no Moromichi was her adopted son.

sen.j: 生後2ヶ月で親王宣下を受ける。
sen.e: She became an Imperial princess two months after her birth by the Imperial proclamation.
She became an Imperial princess two months after her birth by Imperial proclamation.
She became an Imperial Princess two months after her birth by Imperial proclamation.
sen.cmt: Princess と大文字にしました。

sen.j: 母后嫄子の死後は頼通に養育され、長久元年（1040年）10月に着袴と共に准后。
sen.e: After her mother, the Empress Genshi, died, she was brought up by Yorimichi and was conferred in October 1040 the title of Jugo (honorable title next to three empresses) at the same time with the ceremony of chakko (first-time wearing of hakama).

After her mother, the Empress Genshi, died, she was brought up by Yorimichi and was conferred in October 1040 the title of Jugo (honorable title next to three empresses) at the same time during the ceremony of chakko (first-time wearing of hakama).

After her mother, the Empress Genshi, died, she was brought up by Yorimichi and was conferred in November 1040 the title of Jugo (honorable title next to three empresses) at the same time during the ceremony of chakko (first-time wearing of hakama).
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。

sen.j: 頼通とともに高倉第に住んでいたため、高倉一宮あるいは高倉殿宮と呼ばれた。
sen.e: As she lived at Takakura-dai residence along with Yorimichi, she was called Takakura no ichimiya or Takakuradono no miya.
As she lived at the Takakura-dai residence along with Yorimichi, she was called Takakura no ichimiya or Takakuradono no miya.
As she lived at the Takakura-dai residence along with Yorimichi, she was called Takakura no ichimiya or Takakuradono no miya.
She entered the Buddhist priesthood in 1072.
She entered the Buddhist priesthood in 1072.
She entered the Buddhist priesthood in 1072.

sen.j: 承保元年（1074年）甥白河天皇から二品を授けられたが辞退した。
sen.e: Although she was conferred the court rank of Nihon (the second court rank for Imperial prince/princess) by the Emperor Shirakawa, her nephew, she declined.
Although she was conferred the court rank of Nihon (the second court rank for Imperial prince/princess) by Emperor Shirakawa, her nephew, she declined.
Although she was conferred the court rank of Nihon (the second court rank for Imperial Prince/Princess) in 1074 by Emperor Shirakawa, her nephew, she declined.

sen.j: 長治2年（1105年）11月7日、68歳で薨去。
sen.e: She died on November 7, 1105 at the age of 68.
She died on November 7, 1105 at the age of 68.
She died on December 22, 1105 at the age of 68.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。

sen.j: 祐子内親王は歌合を盛んに催すなど一大サロンを形成し、歌人の祐子内親王家紀伊や菅原孝標女などが仕えたことで知られる。
sen.e: Imperial princess Yushi often held uta-awase (waka poem competition), organized a big cultural salon around her and was well-known as a person for whom female poets, such as Yushi Naishinoke Kii and SUGAWARA no Takasue no musume, served for her.

Imperial princess Yushi often held uta-awase (waka poem competition), organized a big cultural salon around her and was well-known as a person for whom female poets, such as Yushi Naishinoke Kii and SUGAWARA no Takasue no musume, served for her.

Imperial Princess Yushi often held uta-awase (waka poem competition), organized a big cultural salon around her and was well-known as a person for whom female poets, such as Yushi Naishinno-ke no Kii (Kii, Lady-in-Waiting to Imperial Princess Yushi) and the daughter of SUGAWARA no Takasue, served for her.
sen.cmt: 祐子内親王家紀伊、菅原孝標女 を補足、修正しました。

tit.j: 祐子内親王 （昭和天皇皇女）
tit.e: Imperial princess Yushi (a princess of the Emperor Showa)
Imperial princess Yushi (a princess of Emperor Showa)
Imperial Princess Yushi (a princess of Emperor Showa)
tit.cmt: Princess と大文字にしました。

sen.j: 久宮祐子内親王（ひさのみや さちこないしんのう、1927年9月10日 - 1928年3月8日）は、日本の皇族。
sen.e: Imperial princess Hisanomiya Sachiko (September 10, 1927 - March 8, 1928) was a member of Japanese Imperial family.
Imperial princess Hisanomiya Sachiko (September 10, 1927 - March 8, 1928) was a member of the Japanese Imperial family.
Imperial Princess Hisanomiya Sachiko (September 10, 1927 - March 8, 1928) was a member of the Japanese Imperial Family.
sen.cmt: Princess と大文字にしました。

sen.j: 昭和天皇と香淳皇后の第二皇女。
sen.e: She was born as the second princess between the Emperor Showa and the Empress Kojun.
She was born as the second princess between Emperor Showa and the Empress Kojun.
She was born as the second princess between Emperor Showa and the Empress Kojun.
Her title was Hisanomiya.
Her title was Hisanomiya.
Her title was Hisanomiya.

sen.j: 敗血症のため満六ヶ月で夭折した。
sen.e: She died young only six months after her birth due to septicimia.
She died young only six months after her birth due to septicimia.
She died young only six months after her birth due to septicimia.
